ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Does the client contribute to the RESTfulness of an application?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Yes, the *user agent* ( client is the term for the connector, not the component) is just another component of the application that realizes some use case.

On Mar 10, 2012, at 10:06 PM, Glenn Block wrote:

> 
> Thanks Jan
> 
> If =
am reading the deck properly you are saying the application includes the cl=
ient / server components, the client is not separate. Is that correct?

Yes=
, the *user agent* ('client' is the term for the connector, not the compone=
nt) is just another component of the application that realizes some use cas=
e.

There is conceptually no difference between a monolithic application an=
d a networked application. It is just that in the latter the components res=
ide on different hosts (e.g. your PC and Amazon's server host).

Note how t=
he configuration of the app is different! A monolithic application is confi=
gured (assembled) at compile time, a unix commandline is configured when yo=
u type it (search for 'invisible hand' in the dissertation) and an HTTP (br=
owser based) application is configured when you type the URI(s) in your bro=
wser window(s).

Not browser-based HTTP applications are configured when th=
e user agent component (e.g. the crawler that checks some online shops) is =
configured with its start URIs.

Jan
